text: Resolution adopted by the General Assembly on 24 December 2024
[on the report of the Second Committee (A/79/435/Add.6, para. 16)]
79/235.	Promotion of inclusive and effective international tax cooperation at the United Nations
The General Assembly,
Guided by the purposes and principles enshrined in the Charter of the United Nations,
textWithHighlights: Guided by the purposes and principles enshrined in the Charter of the United Nations,

text: Reaffirming its resolution 69/313 of 27 July 2015 on the Addis Ababa Action Agenda of the Third International Conference on Financing for Development,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming* its resolution 69/313 of 27 July 2015 on the Addis Ababa Action Agenda of the Third International Conference on Financing for Development,

text: Reaffirming also its resolution 70/1 of 25 September 2015, entitled “Transforming our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development”,
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirming also* its resolution 70/1 of 25 September 2015, entitled “Transforming our world: the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development”,

text: Recalling its resolutions 77/244 of 30 December 2022 and 78/230 of 22 December 2023 on the promotion of inclusive and effective international tax cooperation at the United Nations,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its resolutions 77/244 of 30 December 2022 and 78/230 of 22 December 2023 on the promotion of inclusive and effective international tax cooperation at the {{United Nations}},

text: Looking forward to the convening of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development, from 30 June to 3 July 2025, in Seville, Spain,
textWithHighlights: *Looking forward to* the convening of the Fourth International Conference on Financing for Development, from 30 June to 3 July 2025, in Seville, Spain,

text: Recognizing the importance and benefit of developing a United Nations Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation that would receive broad support,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* the importance and benefit of developing a United Nations Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation that would receive broad support,

text: Takes note of the report on the second session of the Ad Hoc Committee to Draft Terms of Reference for a United Nations Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation, and welcomes the completion by the Ad Hoc Committee of its work;

textWithHighlights: *Takes note* of the report on the second session of the {{Ad Hoc Committee to Draft Terms of Reference for a United Nations Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation}}, and *welcomes* the completion by the {{Ad Hoc Committee}} of its work;

text: Decides to adopt the terms of reference for a United Nations Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation as contained in annex I to the report on the second session of the Ad Hoc Committee;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Terms of reference for UN Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Ad Hoc Committee to Draft Terms of Reference for a United Nations Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation

textWithHighlights: *Decides* to adopt the [[terms of reference]] for a United Nations Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation as contained in annex I to the report on the second session of the {{Ad Hoc Committee}};
uncertainties: Classified the adopted 'terms of reference' as a policy deliverable; could arguably be considered standards.

text: Also decides to establish a Member State-led, open-ended intergovernmental negotiating committee for the purpose of drafting the United Nations Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation and two early protocols simultaneously in accordance with the terms of reference;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Intergovernmental negotiating committee on international tax cooperation

textWithHighlights: Also *decides* to establish a {{Member State}}-led, open-ended [[intergovernmental negotiating committee]] for the purpose of drafting the United Nations Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation and two early protocols simultaneously in accordance with the terms of reference;
uncertainties: Classified the establishment of a committee under the 'meeting' deliverable type; there is no specific category for establishing bodies, but this seems the closest fit.

text: Further decides that the intergovernmental negotiating committee shall meet in 2025, 2026 and 2027 for at least three substantive sessions per year, in New York and at other United Nations locations, including Nairobi, of a duration of no more than 10 working days per session, and may convene additional sessions as necessary;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Committee meetings (three substantive sessions per year)

textWithHighlights: *Further decides* that the <<intergovernmental negotiating committee>> shall [[meet]] in 2025, 2026 and 2027 for at least three substantive sessions per year, in New York and at other {{United Nations}} locations, including Nairobi, of a duration of no more than 10 working days per session, and may convene [[additional sessions]] as necessary;

text: Decides that the intergovernmental negotiating committee shall convene an organizational session in New York from 3 to 6 February 2025 to address and conclude organizational matters, including decision-making rules of the committee, and decide on the subject of the second early protocol, which shall be drawn from the list of specific priority areas set out in the terms of reference;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Subject of the second early protocol
deliverables.deliverable: subject of the second early protocol

textWithHighlights: *Decides* that the <<intergovernmental negotiating committee>> shall convene an [[organizational session]] in New York from 3 to 6 February 2025 to address and conclude organizational matters, including [[decision-making rules]] of the committee, and decide on the [[subject of the second early protocol]], which shall be drawn from the list of specific priority areas set out in the terms of reference;
uncertainties: Classifying “subject of the second early protocol” as a deliverable of type policy is somewhat interpretive; it represents a concrete decision outcome rather than a document. The intergovernmental negotiating committee is not on the predefined entity list and is treated as 'other'.

text: Also decides that the Bureau of the intergovernmental negotiating committee shall consist of a Chair, 18 Vice-Chairs and a Rapporteur, elected on the basis of equitable geographical representation and taking into account gender balance;
textWithHighlights: *Also decides* that the Bureau of the intergovernmental negotiating committee shall consist of a [[Chair, 18 Vice-Chairs and a Rapporteur]], elected on the basis of equitable geographical representation and taking into account gender balance;

text: Stresses that Member States should be fully engaged in the negotiation of the framework convention and endeavour to ensure continuity in their representation;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* that <<Member States>> should be fully engaged in the negotiation of the framework convention and endeavour to ensure continuity in their representation;

text: Invites the Chair of the intergovernmental negotiating committee, in consultation with the Bureau, to consider convening informal consultations between sessions, as required, in the most efficient and effective manner;

assignees.assignee_normalized: Chair of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee on International Tax Cooperation
assignees.assignee: Chair of the intergovernmental negotiating committee

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity_normalized: Bureau of the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee on International Tax Cooperation

textWithHighlights: *Invites* the <<Chair of the intergovernmental negotiating committee>>, in consultation with the {{Bureau}}, to consider convening [[informal consultations between sessions]], as required, in the most efficient and effective manner;
uncertainties: The Bureau is referenced only as being consulted, not directly tasked. The exact official titles of the committee and its Bureau are inferred from context. The deliverable reflects potential convening of informal consultations (the text says to consider convening).

text: Recognizes that, throughout its work, the intergovernmental negotiating committee should take into consideration the work of other relevant forums, potential synergies and the existing tools, strengths, expertise and complementarities available in the multiple institutions involved in tax cooperation at the international, regional and local levels;
textWithHighlights: *Recognizes* that, throughout its work, the {{intergovernmental negotiating committee}} should take into consideration the work of other relevant forums, potential synergies and the existing tools, strengths, expertise and complementarities available in the multiple institutions involved in tax cooperation at the international, regional and local levels;

text: Encourages international organizations, civil society and other relevant stakeholders to contribute to the work of the intergovernmental negotiating committee in accordance with established practices;
textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<international organizations>>, <<civil society>> and other relevant stakeholders to contribute to the work of the {{intergovernmental negotiating committee}} in accordance with established practices;
uncertainties: "Contribute to the work" is broad and not extracted as a deliverable; could be interpreted as information sharing or support but lacks concreteness.

text: Requests the intergovernmental negotiating committee to complete its work and submit the final text of the framework convention and of the two early protocols to the General Assembly for its consideration in the first quarter of its eighty-second session;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Final text of framework convention and two early protocols
deliverables.deliverable: final text of the framework convention and of the two early protocols

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<intergovernmental negotiating committee>> to complete its work and submit the [[final text of the framework convention and of the two early protocols]] to the {{General Assembly}} for its consideration in the first quarter of its eighty-second session;

text: Requests the Secretary-General to provide the intergovernmental negotiating committee with the necessary facilities and resources, including a technical secretariat from the Department for General Assembly and Conference Management and a substantive secretariat from the Department of Economic and Social Affairs of the Secretariat, to support its work;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Department for General Assembly and Conference Management
Department of Economic and Social Affairs

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to provide the {{intergovernmental negotiating committee}} with the [[necessary facilities and resources]], including a [[technical secretariat]] from the {{Department for General Assembly and Conference Management}} and a [[substantive secretariat]] from the {{Department of Economic and Social Affairs}} of the {{Secretariat}}, to support its work;
uncertainties: Classifying “technical/substantive secretariat” as technical_assistance vs infrastructure is judgment-based; they could arguably be administrative/institutional support.

text: Encourages Member States and other relevant stakeholders in a position to do so to assist in ensuring the full and effective participation of developing countries, including in particular the least developed countries, in the negotiation of the framework convention, including by covering travel and local expenses and through capacity-building;
textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<Member States>> and other relevant stakeholders in a position to do so to assist in ensuring the full and effective participation of {{developing countries}}, including in particular the {{least developed countries}}, in the negotiation of the framework convention, including by [[covering travel and local expenses]] and through [[capacity-building]];

text: Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eightieth session, under the item entitled “Macroeconomic policy questions”, the sub-item entitled “Promotion of inclusive and effective international tax cooperation at the United Nations”.
